3449 for (ImFont* font : atlas->Fonts)
3450 font->Sources.resize(0);
3451 for (ImFontConfig& src : atlas->Sources)
3452 src.DstFont->Sources.push_back(&src);
3453}
3454
3455// Render a white-colored bitmap encoded in a string
3456void ImFontAtlasBuildRenderBitmapFromString(ImFontAtlas* atlas, int x, int y, int w, int h, const char* in_str, char in_marker_char)
3457{
3458 ImTextureData* tex = atlas->TexData;
3459 IM_ASSERT(x >= 0 && x + w <= tex->Width);
3460 IM_ASSERT(y >= 0 && y + h <= tex->Height);
3461
3462 switch (tex->Format)
3463 {
3464 case ImTextureFormat_Alpha8:
3465 {
3466 ImU8* out_p = (ImU8*)tex->GetPixelsAt(x, y);
3467 for (int off_y = 0; off_y < h; off_y++, out_p += tex->Width, in_str += w)
3468 for (int off_x = 0; off_x < w; off_x++)
3469 out_p[off_x] = (in_str[off_x] == in_marker_char) ? 0xFF : 0x00;
3470 break;
3471 }
3472 case ImTextureFormat_RGBA32:
3473 {
3474 ImU32* out_p = (ImU32*)tex->GetPixelsAt(x, y);
3475 for (int off_y = 0; off_y < h; off_y++, out_p += tex->Width, in_str += w)
3476 for (int off_x = 0; off_x < w; off_x++)
3477 out_p[off_x] = (in_str[off_x] == in_marker_char) ? IM_COL32_WHITE : IM_COL32_BLACK_TRANS;
3478 break;
3479 }
3480 }
3481}
3482
3483static void ImFontAtlasBuildUpdateBasicTexData(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
3484{
3485 // Pack and store identifier so we can refresh UV coordinates on texture resize.
3486 // FIXME-NEWATLAS: User/custom rects where user code wants to store UV coordinates will need to do the same thing.
3487 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
3488 ImVec2i pack_size = (atlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors) ? ImVec2i(2, 2) : ImVec2i(FONT_ATLAS_DEFAULT_TEX_DATA_W * 2 + 1, FONT_ATLAS_DEFAULT_TEX_DATA_H);
3489
3490 ImFontAtlasRect r;
3491 bool add_and_draw = (atlas->GetCustomRect(builder->PackIdMouseCursors, &r) == false);
3492 if (add_and_draw)
3493 {
3494 builder->PackIdMouseCursors = atlas->AddCustomRect(pack_size.x, pack_size.y, &r);
3495 IM_ASSERT(builder->PackIdMouseCursors != ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid);
3496
3497 // Draw to texture
3498 if (atlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoMouseCursors)
3499 {
3500 // 2x2 white pixels
3501 ImFontAtlasBuildRenderBitmapFromString(atlas, r.x, r.y, 2, 2, "XX" "XX", 'X');
3502 }
3503 else
3504 {
3505 // 2x2 white pixels + mouse cursors
3506 const int x_for_white = r.x;
3507 const int x_for_black = r.x + FONT_ATLAS_DEFAULT_TEX_DATA_W + 1;
3508 ImFontAtlasBuildRenderBitmapFromString(atlas, x_for_white, r.y, FONT_ATLAS_DEFAULT_TEX_DATA_W, FONT_ATLAS_DEFAULT_TEX_DATA_H, FONT_ATLAS_DEFAULT_TEX_DATA_PIXELS, '.');
3509 ImFontAtlasBuildRenderBitmapFromString(atlas, x_for_black, r.y, FONT_ATLAS_DEFAULT_TEX_DATA_W, FONT_ATLAS_DEFAULT_TEX_DATA_H, FONT_ATLAS_DEFAULT_TEX_DATA_PIXELS, 'X');
3510 }
3511 }
3512
3513 // Refresh UV coordinates
3514 atlas->TexUvWhitePixel = ImVec2((r.x + 0.5f) * atlas->TexUvScale.x, (r.y + 0.5f) * atlas->TexUvScale.y);
3515}
3516
3517static void ImFontAtlasBuildUpdateLinesTexData(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
3518{
3519 if (atlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoBakedLines)
3520 return;
3521
3522 // Pack and store identifier so we can refresh UV coordinates on texture resize.
3523 ImTextureData* tex = atlas->TexData;
3524 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
3525
3526 ImFontAtlasRect r;
3527 bool add_and_draw = atlas->GetCustomRect(builder->PackIdLinesTexData, &r) == false;
3528 if (add_and_draw)
3529 {
3530 ImVec2i pack_size = ImVec2i(IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX + 2, IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX + 1);
3531 builder->PackIdLinesTexData = atlas->AddCustomRect(pack_size.x, pack_size.y, &r);
3532 IM_ASSERT(builder->PackIdLinesTexData != ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid);
3533 }
3534
3535 // Register texture region for thick lines
3536 // The +2 here is to give space for the end caps, whilst height +1 is to accommodate the fact we have a zero-width row
3537 // This generates a triangular shape in the texture, with the various line widths stacked on top of each other to allow interpolation between them
3538 for (int n = 0; n < IM_DRAWLIST_TEX_LINES_WIDTH_MAX + 1; n++) // +1 because of the zero-width row
3539 {
3540 // Each line consists of at least two empty pixels at the ends, with a line of solid pixels in the middle
3541 const int y = n;
3542 const int line_width = n;
3543 const int pad_left = (r.w - line_width) / 2;
3544 const int pad_right = r.w - (pad_left + line_width);
3545 IM_ASSERT(pad_left + line_width + pad_right == r.w && y < r.h); // Make sure we're inside the texture bounds before we start writing pixels
3546
3547 // Write each slice
3548 if (add_and_draw && tex->Format == ImTextureFormat_Alpha8)
3549 {
3550 ImU8* write_ptr = (ImU8*)tex->GetPixelsAt(r.x, r.y + y);
3551 for (int i = 0; i < pad_left; i++)
3552 *(write_ptr + i) = 0x00;
3553
3554 for (int i = 0; i < line_width; i++)
3555 *(write_ptr + pad_left + i) = 0xFF;
3556
3557 for (int i = 0; i < pad_right; i++)
3558 *(write_ptr + pad_left + line_width + i) = 0x00;
3559 }
3560 else if (add_and_draw && tex->Format == ImTextureFormat_RGBA32)
3561 {
3562 ImU32* write_ptr = (ImU32*)(void*)tex->GetPixelsAt(r.x, r.y + y);
3563 for (int i = 0; i < pad_left; i++)
3564 *(write_ptr + i) = IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 0);
3565
3566 for (int i = 0; i < line_width; i++)
3567 *(write_ptr + pad_left + i) = IM_COL32_WHITE;
3568
3569 for (int i = 0; i < pad_right; i++)
3570 *(write_ptr + pad_left + line_width + i) = IM_COL32(255, 255, 255, 0);
3571 }
3572
3573 // Refresh UV coordinates
3574 ImVec2 uv0 = ImVec2((float)(r.x + pad_left - 1), (float)(r.y + y)) * atlas->TexUvScale;
3575 ImVec2 uv1 = ImVec2((float)(r.x + pad_left + line_width + 1), (float)(r.y + y + 1)) * atlas->TexUvScale;
3576 float half_v = (uv0.y + uv1.y) * 0.5f; // Calculate a constant V in the middle of the row to avoid sampling artifacts
3577 atlas->TexUvLines[n] = ImVec4(uv0.x, half_v, uv1.x, half_v);
3578 }
3579}
3580
3581//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3582
3583// Was tempted to lazily init FontSrc but wouldn't save much + makes it more complicated to detect invalid data at AddFont()
3584bool ImFontAtlasFontInitOutput(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font)
3585{
3586 bool ret = true;
3587 for (ImFontConfig* src : font->Sources)
3588 if (!ImFontAtlasFontSourceInit(atlas, src))
3589 ret = false;
3590 IM_ASSERT(ret); // Unclear how to react to this meaningfully. Assume that result will be same as initial AddFont() call.
3591 return ret;
3592}
3593
3594// Keep source/input FontData
3595void ImFontAtlasFontDestroyOutput(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font)
3596{
3597 font->ClearOutputData();
3598 for (ImFontConfig* src : font->Sources)
3599 {
3600 const ImFontLoader* loader = src->FontLoader ? src->FontLoader : atlas->FontLoader;
3601 if (loader && loader->FontSrcDestroy != NULL)
3602 loader->FontSrcDestroy(atlas, src);
3603 }
3604}
3605
3606//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------------
3607
3608bool ImFontAtlasFontSourceInit(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontConfig* src)
3609{
3610 const ImFontLoader* loader = src->FontLoader ? src->FontLoader : atlas->FontLoader;
3611 if (loader->FontSrcInit != NULL && !loader->FontSrcInit(atlas, src))
3612 return false;
3613 return true;
3614}
3615
3616void ImFontAtlasFontSourceAddToFont(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font, ImFontConfig* src)
3617{
3618 if (src->MergeMode == false)
3619 {
3620 font->ClearOutputData();
3621 //font->FontSize = src->SizePixels;
3622 font->ContainerAtlas = atlas;
3623 IM_ASSERT(font->Sources[0] == src);
3624 }
3625 atlas->TexIsBuilt = false; // For legacy backends
3626 ImFontAtlasBuildSetupFontSpecialGlyphs(atlas, font, src);
3627}
3628
3629void ImFontAtlasFontDestroySourceData(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontConfig* src)
3630{
3631 IM_UNUSED(atlas);
3632 if (src->FontDataOwnedByAtlas)
3633 IM_FREE(src->FontData);
3634 src->FontData = NULL;
3635 if (src->GlyphExcludeRanges)
3636 IM_FREE((void*)src->GlyphExcludeRanges);
3637 src->GlyphExcludeRanges = NULL;
3638}
3639
3640// Create a compact, baked "..." if it doesn't exist, by using the ".".
3641// This may seem overly complicated right now but the point is to exercise and improve a technique which should be increasingly used.
3642// FIXME-NEWATLAS: This borrows too much from FontLoader's FontLoadGlyph() handlers and suggest that we should add further helpers.
3643static ImFontGlyph* ImFontAtlasBuildSetupFontBakedEllipsis(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontBaked* baked)
3644{
3645 ImFont* font = baked->ContainerFont;
3646 IM_ASSERT(font->EllipsisChar != 0);
3647
3648 const ImFontGlyph* dot_glyph = baked->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)'.');
3649 if (dot_glyph == NULL)
3650 dot_glyph = baked->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)0xFF0E);
3651 if (dot_glyph == NULL)
3652 return NULL;
3653 ImFontAtlasRectId dot_r_id = dot_glyph->PackId; // Deep copy to avoid invalidation of glyphs and rect pointers
3654 ImTextureRect* dot_r = ImFontAtlasPackGetRect(atlas, dot_r_id);
3655 const int dot_spacing = 1;
3656 const float dot_step = (dot_glyph->X1 - dot_glyph->X0) + dot_spacing;
3657
3658 ImFontAtlasRectId pack_id = ImFontAtlasPackAddRect(atlas, (dot_r->w * 3 + dot_spacing * 2), dot_r->h);
3659 ImTextureRect* r = ImFontAtlasPackGetRect(atlas, pack_id);
3660
3661 ImFontGlyph glyph_in = {};
3662 ImFontGlyph* glyph = &glyph_in;
3663 glyph->Codepoint = font->EllipsisChar;
3664 glyph->AdvanceX = ImMax(dot_glyph->AdvanceX, dot_glyph->X0 + dot_step * 3.0f - dot_spacing); // FIXME: Slightly odd for normally mono-space fonts but since this is used for trailing contents.
3665 glyph->X0 = dot_glyph->X0;
3666 glyph->Y0 = dot_glyph->Y0;
3667 glyph->X1 = dot_glyph->X0 + dot_step * 3 - dot_spacing;
3668 glyph->Y1 = dot_glyph->Y1;
3669 glyph->Visible = true;
3670 glyph->PackId = pack_id;
3671 glyph = ImFontAtlasBakedAddFontGlyph(atlas, baked, NULL, glyph);
3672 dot_glyph = NULL; // Invalidated
3673
3674 // Copy to texture, post-process and queue update for backend
3675 // FIXME-NEWATLAS-V2: Dot glyph is already post-processed as this point, so this would damage it.
3676 dot_r = ImFontAtlasPackGetRect(atlas, dot_r_id);
3677 ImTextureData* tex = atlas->TexData;
3678 for (int n = 0; n < 3; n++)
3679 ImFontAtlasTextureBlockCopy(tex, dot_r->x, dot_r->y, tex, r->x + (dot_r->w + dot_spacing) * n, r->y, dot_r->w, dot_r->h);
3680 ImFontAtlasTextureBlockQueueUpload(atlas, tex, r->x, r->y, r->w, r->h);
3681
3682 return glyph;
3683}
3684
3685// Load fallback in order to obtain its index
3686// (this is called from in hot-path so we avoid extraneous parameters to minimize impact on code size)
3687static void ImFontAtlasBuildSetupFontBakedFallback(ImFontBaked* baked)
3688{
3689 IM_ASSERT(baked->FallbackGlyphIndex == -1);
3690 IM_ASSERT(baked->FallbackAdvanceX == 0.0f);
3691 ImFont* font = baked->ContainerFont;
3692 ImFontGlyph* fallback_glyph = NULL;
3693 if (font->FallbackChar != 0)
3694 fallback_glyph = baked->FindGlyphNoFallback(font->FallbackChar);
3695 if (fallback_glyph == NULL)
3696 {
3697 ImFontGlyph* space_glyph = baked->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)' ');
3698 ImFontGlyph glyph;
3699 glyph.Codepoint = 0;
3700 glyph.AdvanceX = space_glyph ? space_glyph->AdvanceX : IM_ROUND(baked->Size * 0.40f);
3701 fallback_glyph = ImFontAtlasBakedAddFontGlyph(font->ContainerAtlas, baked, NULL, &glyph);
3702 }
3703 baked->FallbackGlyphIndex = baked->Glyphs.index_from_ptr(fallback_glyph); // Storing index avoid need to update pointer on growth and simplify inner loop code
3704 baked->FallbackAdvanceX = fallback_glyph->AdvanceX;
3705}
3706
3707static void ImFontAtlasBuildSetupFontBakedBlanks(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontBaked* baked)
3708{
3709 // Mark space as always hidden (not strictly correct/necessary. but some e.g. icons fonts don't have a space. it tends to look neater in previews)
3710 ImFontGlyph* space_glyph = baked->FindGlyphNoFallback((ImWchar)' ');
3711 if (space_glyph != NULL)
3712 space_glyph->Visible = false;
3713
3714 // Setup Tab character.
3715 // FIXME: Needs proper TAB handling but it needs to be contextualized (or we could arbitrary say that each string starts at "column 0" ?)
3716 if (baked->FindGlyphNoFallback('\t') == NULL && space_glyph != NULL)
3717 {
3718 ImFontGlyph tab_glyph;
3719 tab_glyph.Codepoint = '\t';
3720 tab_glyph.AdvanceX = space_glyph->AdvanceX * IM_TABSIZE;
3721 ImFontAtlasBakedAddFontGlyph(atlas, baked, NULL, &tab_glyph);
3722 }
3723}
3724
3725// Load/identify special glyphs
3726// (note that this is called again for fonts with MergeMode)
3727void ImFontAtlasBuildSetupFontSpecialGlyphs(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font, ImFontConfig* src)
3728{
3729 IM_UNUSED(atlas);
3730 IM_ASSERT(font->Sources.contains(src));
3731
3732 // Find Fallback character. Actual glyph loaded in GetFontBaked().
3733 const ImWchar fallback_chars[] = { font->FallbackChar, (ImWchar)IM_UNICODE_CODEPOINT_INVALID, (ImWchar)'?', (ImWchar)' ' };
3734 if (font->FallbackChar == 0)
3735 for (ImWchar candidate_char : fallback_chars)
3736 if (candidate_char != 0 && font->IsGlyphInFont(candidate_char))
3737 {
3738 font->FallbackChar = (ImWchar)candidate_char;
3739 break;
3740 }
3741
3742 // Setup Ellipsis character. It is required for rendering elided text. We prefer using U+2026 (horizontal ellipsis).
3743 // However some old fonts may contain ellipsis at U+0085. Here we auto-detect most suitable ellipsis character.
3744 // FIXME: Note that 0x2026 is rarely included in our font ranges. Because of this we are more likely to use three individual dots.
3745 const ImWchar ellipsis_chars[] = { src->EllipsisChar, (ImWchar)0x2026, (ImWchar)0x0085 };
3746 if (font->EllipsisChar == 0)
3747 for (ImWchar candidate_char : ellipsis_chars)
3748 if (candidate_char != 0 && font->IsGlyphInFont(candidate_char))
3749 {
3750 font->EllipsisChar = candidate_char;
3751 break;
3752 }
3753 if (font->EllipsisChar == 0)
3754 {
3755 font->EllipsisChar = 0x0085;
3756 font->EllipsisAutoBake = true;
3757 }
3758}
3759
3760void ImFontAtlasBakedDiscardFontGlyph(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font, ImFontBaked* baked, ImFontGlyph* glyph)
3761{
3762 if (glyph->PackId != ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid)
3763 {
3764 ImFontAtlasPackDiscardRect(atlas, glyph->PackId);
3765 glyph->PackId = ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid;
3766 }
3767 ImWchar c = (ImWchar)glyph->Codepoint;
3768 IM_ASSERT(font->FallbackChar != c && font->EllipsisChar != c); // Unsupported for simplicity
3769 IM_ASSERT(glyph >= baked->Glyphs.Data && glyph < baked->Glyphs.Data + baked->Glyphs.Size);
3770 IM_UNUSED(font);
3771 baked->IndexLookup[c] = IM_FONTGLYPH_INDEX_UNUSED;
3772 baked->IndexAdvanceX[c] = baked->FallbackAdvanceX;
3773}
3774
3775ImFontBaked* ImFontAtlasBakedAdd(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font, float font_size, float font_rasterizer_density, ImGuiID baked_id)
3776{
3777 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] Created baked %.2fpx\n", font_size);
3778 ImFontBaked* baked = atlas->Builder->BakedPool.push_back(ImFontBaked());
3779 baked->Size = font_size;
3780 baked->RasterizerDensity = font_rasterizer_density;
3781 baked->BakedId = baked_id;
3782 baked->ContainerFont = font;
3783 baked->LastUsedFrame = atlas->Builder->FrameCount;
3784
3785 // Initialize backend data
3786 size_t loader_data_size = 0;
3787 for (ImFontConfig* src : font->Sources) // Cannot easily be cached as we allow changing backend
3788 {
3789 const ImFontLoader* loader = src->FontLoader ? src->FontLoader : atlas->FontLoader;
3790 loader_data_size += loader->FontBakedSrcLoaderDataSize;
3791 }
3792 baked->FontLoaderDatas = (loader_data_size > 0) ? IM_ALLOC(loader_data_size) : NULL;
3793 char* loader_data_p = (char*)baked->FontLoaderDatas;
3794 for (ImFontConfig* src : font->Sources)
3795 {
3796 const ImFontLoader* loader = src->FontLoader ? src->FontLoader : atlas->FontLoader;
3797 if (loader->FontBakedInit)
3798 loader->FontBakedInit(atlas, src, baked, loader_data_p);
3799 loader_data_p += loader->FontBakedSrcLoaderDataSize;
3800 }
3801
3802 ImFontAtlasBuildSetupFontBakedBlanks(atlas, baked);
3803 return baked;
3804}
3805
3806// FIXME-OPT: This is not a fast query. Adding a BakedCount field in Font might allow to take a shortcut for the most common case.
3807ImFontBaked* ImFontAtlasBakedGetClosestMatch(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font, float font_size, float font_rasterizer_density)
3808{
3809 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
3810 for (int step_n = 0; step_n < 2; step_n++)
3811 {
3812 ImFontBaked* closest_larger_match = NULL;
3813 ImFontBaked* closest_smaller_match = NULL;
3814 for (int baked_n = 0; baked_n < builder->BakedPool.Size; baked_n++)
3815 {
3816 ImFontBaked* baked = &builder->BakedPool[baked_n];
3817 if (baked->ContainerFont != font || baked->WantDestroy)
3818 continue;
3819 if (step_n == 0 && baked->RasterizerDensity != font_rasterizer_density) // First try with same density
3820 continue;
3821 if (baked->Size > font_size && (closest_larger_match == NULL || baked->Size < closest_larger_match->Size))
3822 closest_larger_match = baked;
3823 if (baked->Size < font_size && (closest_smaller_match == NULL || baked->Size > closest_smaller_match->Size))
3824 closest_smaller_match = baked;
3825 }
3826 if (closest_larger_match)
3827 if (closest_smaller_match == NULL || (closest_larger_match->Size >= font_size * 2.0f && closest_smaller_match->Size > font_size * 0.5f))
3828 return closest_larger_match;
3829 if (closest_smaller_match)
3830 return closest_smaller_match;
3831 }
3832 return NULL;
3833}
3834
3835void ImFontAtlasBakedDiscard(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font, ImFontBaked* baked)
3836{
3837 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
3838 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] Discard baked %.2f for \"%s\"\n", baked->Size, font->GetDebugName());
3839
3840 for (ImFontGlyph& glyph : baked->Glyphs)
3841 if (glyph.PackId != ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid)
3842 ImFontAtlasPackDiscardRect(atlas, glyph.PackId);
3843
3844 char* loader_data_p = (char*)baked->FontLoaderDatas;
3845 for (ImFontConfig* src : font->Sources)
3846 {
3847 const ImFontLoader* loader = src->FontLoader ? src->FontLoader : atlas->FontLoader;
3848 if (loader->FontBakedDestroy)
3849 loader->FontBakedDestroy(atlas, src, baked, loader_data_p);
3850 loader_data_p += loader->FontBakedSrcLoaderDataSize;
3851 }
3852 if (baked->FontLoaderDatas)
3853 {
3854 IM_FREE(baked->FontLoaderDatas);
3855 baked->FontLoaderDatas = NULL;
3856 }
3857 builder->BakedMap.SetVoidPtr(baked->BakedId, NULL);
3858 builder->BakedDiscardedCount++;
3859 baked->ClearOutputData();
3860 baked->WantDestroy = true;
3861 font->LastBaked = NULL;
3862}
3863
3864// use unused_frames==0 to discard everything.
3865void ImFontAtlasFontDiscardBakes(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font, int unused_frames)
3866{
3867 if (ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder) // This can be called from font destructor
3868 for (int baked_n = 0; baked_n < builder->BakedPool.Size; baked_n++)
3869 {
3870 ImFontBaked* baked = &builder->BakedPool[baked_n];
3871 if (baked->LastUsedFrame + unused_frames > atlas->Builder->FrameCount)
3872 continue;
3873 if (baked->ContainerFont != font || baked->WantDestroy)
3874 continue;
3875 ImFontAtlasBakedDiscard(atlas, font, baked);
3876 }
3877}
3878
3879// use unused_frames==0 to discard everything.
3880void ImFontAtlasBuildDiscardBakes(ImFontAtlas* atlas, int unused_frames)
3881{
3882 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
3883 for (int baked_n = 0; baked_n < builder->BakedPool.Size; baked_n++)
3884 {
3885 ImFontBaked* baked = &builder->BakedPool[baked_n];
3886 if (baked->LastUsedFrame + unused_frames > atlas->Builder->FrameCount)
3887 continue;
3888 if (baked->WantDestroy || (baked->ContainerFont->Flags & ImFontFlags_LockBakedSizes))
3889 continue;
3890 ImFontAtlasBakedDiscard(atlas, baked->ContainerFont, baked);
3891 }
3892}
3893
3894// Those functions are designed to facilitate changing the underlying structures for ImFontAtlas to store an array of ImDrawListSharedData*
3895void ImFontAtlasAddDrawListSharedData(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImDrawListSharedData* data)
3896{
3897 IM_ASSERT(!atlas->DrawListSharedDatas.contains(data));
3898 atlas->DrawListSharedDatas.push_back(data);
3899}
3900
3901void ImFontAtlasRemoveDrawListSharedData(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImDrawListSharedData* data)
3902{
3903 IM_ASSERT(atlas->DrawListSharedDatas.contains(data));
3904 atlas->DrawListSharedDatas.find_erase(data);
3905}
3906
3907// Update texture identifier in all active draw lists
3908void ImFontAtlasUpdateDrawListsTextures(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImTextureRef old_tex, ImTextureRef new_tex)
3909{
3910 for (ImDrawListSharedData* shared_data : atlas->DrawListSharedDatas)
3911 for (ImDrawList* draw_list : shared_data->DrawLists)
3912 {
3913 // Replace in command-buffer
3914 // (there is not need to replace in ImDrawListSplitter: current channel is in ImDrawList's CmdBuffer[],
3915 // other channels will be on SetCurrentChannel() which already needs to compare CmdHeader anyhow)
3916 if (draw_list->CmdBuffer.Size > 0 && draw_list->_CmdHeader.TexRef == old_tex)
3917 draw_list->_SetTexture(new_tex);
3918
3919 // Replace in stack
3920 for (ImTextureRef& stacked_tex : draw_list->_TextureStack)
3921 if (stacked_tex == old_tex)
3922 stacked_tex = new_tex;
3923 }
3924}
3925
3926// Update texture coordinates in all draw list shared context
3927// FIXME-NEWATLAS FIXME-OPT: Doesn't seem necessary to update for all, only one bound to current context?
3928void ImFontAtlasUpdateDrawListsSharedData(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
3929{
3930 for (ImDrawListSharedData* shared_data : atlas->DrawListSharedDatas)
3931 if (shared_data->FontAtlas == atlas)
3932 {
3933 shared_data->TexUvWhitePixel = atlas->TexUvWhitePixel;
3934 shared_data->TexUvLines = atlas->TexUvLines;
3935 }
3936}
3937
3938// Set current texture. This is mostly called from AddTexture() + to handle a failed resize.
3939static void ImFontAtlasBuildSetTexture(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImTextureData* tex)
3940{
3941 ImTextureRef old_tex_ref = atlas->TexRef;
3942 atlas->TexData = tex;
3943 atlas->TexUvScale = ImVec2(1.0f / tex->Width, 1.0f / tex->Height);
3944 atlas->TexRef._TexData = tex;
3945 //atlas->TexRef._TexID = tex->TexID; // <-- We intentionally don't do that. It would be misleading and betray promise that both fields aren't set.
3946 ImFontAtlasUpdateDrawListsTextures(atlas, old_tex_ref, atlas->TexRef);
3947}
3948
3949// Create a new texture, discard previous one
3950ImTextureData* ImFontAtlasTextureAdd(ImFontAtlas* atlas, int w, int h)
3951{
3952 ImTextureData* old_tex = atlas->TexData;
3953 ImTextureData* new_tex;
3954
3955 // FIXME: Cannot reuse texture because old UV may have been used already (unless we remap UV).
3956 /*if (old_tex != NULL && old_tex->Status == ImTextureStatus_WantCreate)
3957 {
3958 // Reuse texture not yet used by backend.
3959 IM_ASSERT(old_tex->TexID == ImTextureID_Invalid && old_tex->BackendUserData == NULL);
3960 old_tex->DestroyPixels();
3961 old_tex->Updates.clear();
3962 new_tex = old_tex;
3963 old_tex = NULL;
3964 }
3965 else*/
3966 {
3967 // Add new
3968 new_tex = IM_NEW(ImTextureData)();
3969 new_tex->UniqueID = atlas->TexNextUniqueID++;
3970 atlas->TexList.push_back(new_tex);
3971 }
3972 if (old_tex != NULL)
3973 {
3974 // Queue old as to destroy next frame
3975 old_tex->WantDestroyNextFrame = true;
3976 IM_ASSERT(old_tex->Status == ImTextureStatus_OK || old_tex->Status == ImTextureStatus_WantCreate || old_tex->Status == ImTextureStatus_WantUpdates);
3977 }
3978
3979 new_tex->Create(atlas->TexDesiredFormat, w, h);
3980 new_tex->Status = ImTextureStatus_WantCreate;
3981 atlas->TexIsBuilt = false;
3982
3983 ImFontAtlasBuildSetTexture(atlas, new_tex);
3984
3985 return new_tex;
3986}
3987
3988#if 0
3989#define STB_IMAGE_WRITE_IMPLEMENTATION
3990#include "../stb/stb_image_write.h"
3991static void ImFontAtlasDebugWriteTexToDisk(ImTextureData* tex, const char* description)
3992{
3993 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
3994 char buf[128];
3995 ImFormatString(buf, IM_ARRAYSIZE(buf), "[%05d] Texture #%03d - %s.png", g.FrameCount, tex->UniqueID, description);
3996 stbi_write_png(buf, tex->Width, tex->Height, tex->BytesPerPixel, tex->Pixels, tex->GetPitch()); // tex->BytesPerPixel is technically not component, but ok for the formats we support.
3997}
3998#endif
3999
4000void ImFontAtlasTextureRepack(ImFontAtlas* atlas, int w, int h)
4001{
4002 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
4003 builder->LockDisableResize = true;
4004
4005 ImTextureData* old_tex = atlas->TexData;
4006 ImTextureData* new_tex = ImFontAtlasTextureAdd(atlas, w, h);
4007 new_tex->UseColors = old_tex->UseColors;
4008 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] Texture #%03d: resize+repack %dx%d => Texture #%03d: %dx%d\n", old_tex->UniqueID, old_tex->Width, old_tex->Height, new_tex->UniqueID, new_tex->Width, new_tex->Height);
4009 //for (int baked_n = 0; baked_n < builder->BakedPool.Size; baked_n++)
4010 // IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] - Baked %.2fpx, %d glyphs, want_destroy=%d\n", builder->BakedPool[baked_n].FontSize, builder->BakedPool[baked_n].Glyphs.Size, builder->BakedPool[baked_n].WantDestroy);
4011 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] - Old packed rects: %d, area %d px\n", builder->RectsPackedCount, builder->RectsPackedSurface);
4012 //ImFontAtlasDebugWriteTexToDisk(old_tex, "Before Pack");
4013
4014 // Repack, lose discarded rectangle, copy pixels
4015 // FIXME-NEWATLAS: This is unstable because packing order is based on RectsIndex
4016 // FIXME-NEWATLAS-V2: Repacking in batch would be beneficial to packing heuristic, and fix stability.
4017 // FIXME-NEWATLAS-TESTS: Test calling RepackTexture with size too small to fits existing rects.
4018 ImFontAtlasPackInit(atlas);
4019 ImVector<ImTextureRect> old_rects;
4020 ImVector<ImFontAtlasRectEntry> old_index = builder->RectsIndex;
4021 old_rects.swap(builder->Rects);
4022
4023 for (ImFontAtlasRectEntry& index_entry : builder->RectsIndex)
4024 {
4025 if (index_entry.IsUsed == false)
4026 continue;
4027 ImTextureRect& old_r = old_rects[index_entry.TargetIndex];
4028 if (old_r.w == 0 && old_r.h == 0)
4029 continue;
4030 ImFontAtlasRectId new_r_id = ImFontAtlasPackAddRect(atlas, old_r.w, old_r.h, &index_entry);
4031 if (new_r_id == ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid)
4032 {
4033 // Undo, grow texture and try repacking again.
4034 // FIXME-NEWATLAS-TESTS: This is a very rarely exercised path! It needs to be automatically tested properly.
4035 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] Texture #%03d: resize failed. Will grow.\n", new_tex->UniqueID);
4036 new_tex->WantDestroyNextFrame = true;
4037 builder->Rects.swap(old_rects);
4038 builder->RectsIndex = old_index;
4039 ImFontAtlasBuildSetTexture(atlas, old_tex);
4040 ImFontAtlasTextureGrow(atlas, w, h); // Recurse
4041 return;
4042 }
4043 IM_ASSERT(ImFontAtlasRectId_GetIndex(new_r_id) == builder->RectsIndex.index_from_ptr(&index_entry));
4044 ImTextureRect* new_r = ImFontAtlasPackGetRect(atlas, new_r_id);
4045 ImFontAtlasTextureBlockCopy(old_tex, old_r.x, old_r.y, new_tex, new_r->x, new_r->y, new_r->w, new_r->h);
4046 }
4047 IM_ASSERT(old_rects.Size == builder->Rects.Size + builder->RectsDiscardedCount);
4048 builder->RectsDiscardedCount = 0;
4049 builder->RectsDiscardedSurface = 0;
4050
4051 // Patch glyphs UV
4052 for (int baked_n = 0; baked_n < builder->BakedPool.Size; baked_n++)
4053 for (ImFontGlyph& glyph : builder->BakedPool[baked_n].Glyphs)
4054 if (glyph.PackId != ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid)
4055 {
4056 ImTextureRect* r = ImFontAtlasPackGetRect(atlas, glyph.PackId);
4057 glyph.U0 = (r->x) * atlas->TexUvScale.x;
4058 glyph.V0 = (r->y) * atlas->TexUvScale.y;
4059 glyph.U1 = (r->x + r->w) * atlas->TexUvScale.x;
4060 glyph.V1 = (r->y + r->h) * atlas->TexUvScale.y;
4061 }
4062
4063 // Update other cached UV
4064 ImFontAtlasBuildUpdateLinesTexData(atlas);
4065 ImFontAtlasBuildUpdateBasicTexData(atlas);
4066
4067 builder->LockDisableResize = false;
4068 ImFontAtlasUpdateDrawListsSharedData(atlas);
4069 //ImFontAtlasDebugWriteTexToDisk(new_tex, "After Pack");
4070}
4071
4072void ImFontAtlasTextureGrow(ImFontAtlas* atlas, int old_tex_w, int old_tex_h)
4073{
4074 //ImFontAtlasDebugWriteTexToDisk(atlas->TexData, "Before Grow");
4075 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
4076 if (old_tex_w == -1)
4077 old_tex_w = atlas->TexData->Width;
4078 if (old_tex_h == -1)
4079 old_tex_h = atlas->TexData->Height;
4080
4081 // FIXME-NEWATLAS-V2: What to do when reaching limits exposed by backend?
4082 // FIXME-NEWATLAS-V2: Does ImFontAtlasFlags_NoPowerOfTwoHeight makes sense now? Allow 'lock' and 'compact' operations?
4083 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(old_tex_w) && ImIsPowerOfTwo(old_tex_h));
4084 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(atlas->TexMinWidth) && ImIsPowerOfTwo(atlas->TexMaxWidth) && ImIsPowerOfTwo(atlas->TexMinHeight) && ImIsPowerOfTwo(atlas->TexMaxHeight));
4085
4086 // Grow texture so it follows roughly a square.
4087 // - Grow height before width, as width imply more packing nodes.
4088 // - Caller should be taking account of RectsDiscardedSurface and may not need to grow.
4089 int new_tex_w = (old_tex_h <= old_tex_w) ? old_tex_w : old_tex_w * 2;
4090 int new_tex_h = (old_tex_h <= old_tex_w) ? old_tex_h * 2 : old_tex_h;
4091
4092 // Handle minimum size first (for pathologically large packed rects)
4093 const int pack_padding = atlas->TexGlyphPadding;
4094 new_tex_w = ImMax(new_tex_w, ImUpperPowerOfTwo(builder->MaxRectSize.x + pack_padding));
4095 new_tex_h = ImMax(new_tex_h, ImUpperPowerOfTwo(builder->MaxRectSize.y + pack_padding));
4096 new_tex_w = ImClamp(new_tex_w, atlas->TexMinWidth, atlas->TexMaxWidth);
4097 new_tex_h = ImClamp(new_tex_h, atlas->TexMinHeight, atlas->TexMaxHeight);
4098 if (new_tex_w == old_tex_w && new_tex_h == old_tex_h)
4099 return;
4100
4101 ImFontAtlasTextureRepack(atlas, new_tex_w, new_tex_h);
4102}
4103
4104void ImFontAtlasTextureMakeSpace(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
4105{
4106 // Can some baked contents be ditched?
4107 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] ImFontAtlasBuildMakeSpace()\n");
4108 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
4109 ImFontAtlasBuildDiscardBakes(atlas, 2);
4110
4111 // Currently using a heuristic for repack without growing.
4112 if (builder->RectsDiscardedSurface < builder->RectsPackedSurface * 0.20f)
4113 ImFontAtlasTextureGrow(atlas);
4114 else
4115 ImFontAtlasTextureRepack(atlas, atlas->TexData->Width, atlas->TexData->Height);
4116}
4117
4118ImVec2i ImFontAtlasTextureGetSizeEstimate(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
4119{
4120 int min_w = ImUpperPowerOfTwo(atlas->TexMinWidth);
4121 int min_h = ImUpperPowerOfTwo(atlas->TexMinHeight);
4122 if (atlas->Builder == NULL || atlas->TexData == NULL || atlas->TexData->Status == ImTextureStatus_WantDestroy)
4123 return ImVec2i(min_w, min_h);
4124
4125 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
4126 min_w = ImMax(ImUpperPowerOfTwo(builder->MaxRectSize.x), min_w);
4127 min_h = ImMax(ImUpperPowerOfTwo(builder->MaxRectSize.y), min_h);
4128 const int surface_approx = builder->RectsPackedSurface - builder->RectsDiscardedSurface; // Expected surface after repack
4129 const int surface_sqrt = (int)sqrtf((float)surface_approx);
4130
4131 int new_tex_w;
4132 int new_tex_h;
4133 if (min_w >= min_h)
4134 {
4135 new_tex_w = ImMax(min_w, ImUpperPowerOfTwo(surface_sqrt));
4136 new_tex_h = ImMax(min_h, (int)((surface_approx + new_tex_w - 1) / new_tex_w));
4137 if ((atlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoPowerOfTwoHeight) == 0)
4138 new_tex_h = ImUpperPowerOfTwo(new_tex_h);
4139 }
4140 else
4141 {
4142 new_tex_h = ImMax(min_h, ImUpperPowerOfTwo(surface_sqrt));
4143 if ((atlas->Flags & ImFontAtlasFlags_NoPowerOfTwoHeight) == 0)
4144 new_tex_h = ImUpperPowerOfTwo(new_tex_h);
4145 new_tex_w = ImMax(min_w, (int)((surface_approx + new_tex_h - 1) / new_tex_h));
4146 }
4147
4148 IM_ASSERT(ImIsPowerOfTwo(new_tex_w) && ImIsPowerOfTwo(new_tex_h));
4149 return ImVec2i(new_tex_w, new_tex_h);
4150}
4151
4152// Clear all output. Invalidates all AddCustomRect() return values!
4153void ImFontAtlasBuildClear(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
4154{
4155 ImVec2i new_tex_size = ImFontAtlasTextureGetSizeEstimate(atlas);
4156 ImFontAtlasBuildDestroy(atlas);
4157 ImFontAtlasTextureAdd(atlas, new_tex_size.x, new_tex_size.y);
4158 ImFontAtlasBuildInit(atlas);
4159 for (ImFontConfig& src : atlas->Sources)
4160 ImFontAtlasFontSourceInit(atlas, &src);
4161 for (ImFont* font : atlas->Fonts)
4162 for (ImFontConfig* src : font->Sources)
4163 ImFontAtlasFontSourceAddToFont(atlas, font, src);
4164}
4165
4166// You should not need to call this manually!
4167// If you think you do, let us know and we can advise about policies auto-compact.
4168void ImFontAtlasTextureCompact(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
4169{
4170 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
4171 ImFontAtlasBuildDiscardBakes(atlas, 1);
4172
4173 ImTextureData* old_tex = atlas->TexData;
4174 ImVec2i old_tex_size = ImVec2i(old_tex->Width, old_tex->Height);
4175 ImVec2i new_tex_size = ImFontAtlasTextureGetSizeEstimate(atlas);
4176 if (builder->RectsDiscardedCount == 0 && new_tex_size.x == old_tex_size.x && new_tex_size.y == old_tex_size.y)
4177 return;
4178
4179 ImFontAtlasTextureRepack(atlas, new_tex_size.x, new_tex_size.y);
4180}
4181
4182// Start packing over current empty texture
4183void ImFontAtlasBuildInit(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
4184{
4185 // Select Backend
4186 // - Note that we do not reassign to atlas->FontLoader, since it is likely to point to static data which
4187 // may mess with some hot-reloading schemes. If you need to assign to this (for dynamic selection) AND are
4188 // using a hot-reloading scheme that messes up static data, store your own instance of FontLoader somewhere
4189 // and point to it instead of pointing directly to return value of the GetFontLoaderXXX functions.
4190 if (atlas->FontLoader == NULL)
4191 {
4192#ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_FREETYPE
4193 atlas->SetFontLoader(ImGuiFreeType::GetFontLoader());
4194#elif defined(IMGUI_ENABLE_STB_TRUETYPE)
4195 atlas->SetFontLoader(ImFontAtlasGetFontLoaderForStbTruetype());
4196#else
4197 IM_ASSERT(0); // Invalid Build function
4198#endif
4199 }
4200
4201 // Create initial texture size
4202 if (atlas->TexData == NULL || atlas->TexData->Pixels == NULL)
4203 ImFontAtlasTextureAdd(atlas, ImUpperPowerOfTwo(atlas->TexMinWidth), ImUpperPowerOfTwo(atlas->TexMinHeight));
4204
4205 atlas->Builder = IM_NEW(ImFontAtlasBuilder)();
4206 if (atlas->FontLoader->LoaderInit)
4207 atlas->FontLoader->LoaderInit(atlas);
4208
4209 ImFontAtlasBuildUpdateRendererHasTexturesFromContext(atlas);
4210
4211 ImFontAtlasPackInit(atlas);
4212
4213 // Add required texture data
4214 ImFontAtlasBuildUpdateLinesTexData(atlas);
4215 ImFontAtlasBuildUpdateBasicTexData(atlas);
4216
4217 // Register fonts
4218 ImFontAtlasBuildUpdatePointers(atlas);
4219
4220 // Update UV coordinates etc. stored in bound ImDrawListSharedData instance
4221 ImFontAtlasUpdateDrawListsSharedData(atlas);
4222
4223 //atlas->TexIsBuilt = true;
4224}
4225
4226// Destroy builder and all cached glyphs. Do not destroy actual fonts.
4227void ImFontAtlasBuildDestroy(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
4228{
4229 for (ImFont* font : atlas->Fonts)
4230 ImFontAtlasFontDestroyOutput(atlas, font);
4231 if (atlas->Builder && atlas->FontLoader && atlas->FontLoader->LoaderShutdown)
4232 {
4233 atlas->FontLoader->LoaderShutdown(atlas);
4234 IM_ASSERT(atlas->FontLoaderData == NULL);
4235 }
4236 IM_DELETE(atlas->Builder);
4237 atlas->Builder = NULL;
4238}
4239
4240void ImFontAtlasPackInit(ImFontAtlas * atlas)
4241{
4242 ImTextureData* tex = atlas->TexData;
4243 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
4244
4245 // In theory we could decide to reduce the number of nodes, e.g. halve them, and waste a little texture space, but it doesn't seem worth it.
4246 const int pack_node_count = tex->Width / 2;
4247 builder->PackNodes.resize(pack_node_count);
4248 IM_STATIC_ASSERT(sizeof(stbrp_context) <= sizeof(stbrp_context_opaque));
4249 stbrp_init_target((stbrp_context*)(void*)&builder->PackContext, tex->Width, tex->Height, builder->PackNodes.Data, builder->PackNodes.Size);
4250 builder->RectsPackedSurface = builder->RectsPackedCount = 0;
4251 builder->MaxRectSize = ImVec2i(0, 0);
4252 builder->MaxRectBounds = ImVec2i(0, 0);
4253}
4254
4255// This is essentially a free-list pattern, it may be nice to wrap it into a dedicated type.
4256static ImFontAtlasRectId ImFontAtlasPackAllocRectEntry(ImFontAtlas* atlas, int rect_idx)
4257{
4258 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = (ImFontAtlasBuilder*)atlas->Builder;
4259 int index_idx;
4260 ImFontAtlasRectEntry* index_entry;
4261 if (builder->RectsIndexFreeListStart < 0)
4262 {
4263 builder->RectsIndex.resize(builder->RectsIndex.Size + 1);
4264 index_idx = builder->RectsIndex.Size - 1;
4265 index_entry = &builder->RectsIndex[index_idx];
4266 memset(index_entry, 0, sizeof(*index_entry));
4267 }
4268 else
4269 {
4270 index_idx = builder->RectsIndexFreeListStart;
4271 index_entry = &builder->RectsIndex[index_idx];
4272 IM_ASSERT(index_entry->IsUsed == false && index_entry->Generation > 0); // Generation is incremented during DiscardRect
4273 builder->RectsIndexFreeListStart = index_entry->TargetIndex;
4274 }
4275 index_entry->TargetIndex = rect_idx;
4276 index_entry->IsUsed = 1;
4277 return ImFontAtlasRectId_Make(index_idx, index_entry->Generation);
4278}
4279
4280// Overwrite existing entry
4281static ImFontAtlasRectId ImFontAtlasPackReuseRectEntry(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontAtlasRectEntry* index_entry)
4282{
4283 IM_ASSERT(index_entry->IsUsed);
4284 index_entry->TargetIndex = atlas->Builder->Rects.Size - 1;
4285 int index_idx = atlas->Builder->RectsIndex.index_from_ptr(index_entry);
4286 return ImFontAtlasRectId_Make(index_idx, index_entry->Generation);
4287}
4288
4289// This is expected to be called in batches and followed by a repack
4290void ImFontAtlasPackDiscardRect(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontAtlasRectId id)
4291{
4292 IM_ASSERT(id != ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid);
4293
4294 ImTextureRect* rect = ImFontAtlasPackGetRect(atlas, id);
4295 if (rect == NULL)
4296 return;
4297
4298 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
4299 int index_idx = ImFontAtlasRectId_GetIndex(id);
4300 ImFontAtlasRectEntry* index_entry = &builder->RectsIndex[index_idx];
4301 IM_ASSERT(index_entry->IsUsed && index_entry->TargetIndex >= 0);
4302 index_entry->IsUsed = false;
4303 index_entry->TargetIndex = builder->RectsIndexFreeListStart;
4304 index_entry->Generation++;
4305
4306 const int pack_padding = atlas->TexGlyphPadding;
4307 builder->RectsIndexFreeListStart = index_idx;
4308 builder->RectsDiscardedCount++;
4309 builder->RectsDiscardedSurface += (rect->w + pack_padding) * (rect->h + pack_padding);
4310 rect->w = rect->h = 0; // Clear rectangle so it won't be packed again
4311}
4312
4313// Important: Calling this may recreate a new texture and therefore change atlas->TexData
4314// FIXME-NEWFONTS: Expose other glyph padding settings for custom alteration (e.g. drop shadows). See #7962
4315ImFontAtlasRectId ImFontAtlasPackAddRect(ImFontAtlas* atlas, int w, int h, ImFontAtlasRectEntry* overwrite_entry)
4316{
4317 IM_ASSERT(w > 0 && w <= 0xFFFF);
4318 IM_ASSERT(h > 0 && h <= 0xFFFF);
4319
4320 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = (ImFontAtlasBuilder*)atlas->Builder;
4321 const int pack_padding = atlas->TexGlyphPadding;
4322 builder->MaxRectSize.x = ImMax(builder->MaxRectSize.x, w);
4323 builder->MaxRectSize.y = ImMax(builder->MaxRectSize.y, h);
4324
4325 // Pack
4326 ImTextureRect r = { 0, 0, (unsigned short)w, (unsigned short)h };
4327 for (int attempts_remaining = 3; attempts_remaining >= 0; attempts_remaining--)
4328 {
4329 // Try packing
4330 stbrp_rect pack_r = {};
4331 pack_r.w = w + pack_padding;
4332 pack_r.h = h + pack_padding;
4333 stbrp_pack_rects((stbrp_context*)(void*)&builder->PackContext, &pack_r, 1);
4334 r.x = (unsigned short)pack_r.x;
4335 r.y = (unsigned short)pack_r.y;
4336 if (pack_r.was_packed)
4337 break;
4338
4339 // If we ran out of attempts, return fallback
4340 if (attempts_remaining == 0 || builder->LockDisableResize)
4341 {
4342 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] Failed packing %dx%d rectangle. Returning fallback.\n", w, h);
4343 return ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid;
4344 }
4345
4346 // Resize or repack atlas! (this should be a rare event)
4347 ImFontAtlasTextureMakeSpace(atlas);
4348 }
4349
4350 builder->MaxRectBounds.x = ImMax(builder->MaxRectBounds.x, r.x + r.w + pack_padding);
4351 builder->MaxRectBounds.y = ImMax(builder->MaxRectBounds.y, r.y + r.h + pack_padding);
4352 builder->RectsPackedCount++;
4353 builder->RectsPackedSurface += (w + pack_padding) * (h + pack_padding);
4354
4355 builder->Rects.push_back(r);
4356 if (overwrite_entry != NULL)
4357 return ImFontAtlasPackReuseRectEntry(atlas, overwrite_entry); // Write into an existing entry instead of adding one (used during repack)
4358 else
4359 return ImFontAtlasPackAllocRectEntry(atlas, builder->Rects.Size - 1);
4360}
4361
4362// Generally for non-user facing functions: assert on invalid ID.
4363ImTextureRect* ImFontAtlasPackGetRect(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontAtlasRectId id)
4364{
4365 IM_ASSERT(id != ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid);
4366 int index_idx = ImFontAtlasRectId_GetIndex(id);
4367 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = (ImFontAtlasBuilder*)atlas->Builder;
4368 ImFontAtlasRectEntry* index_entry = &builder->RectsIndex[index_idx];
4369 IM_ASSERT(index_entry->Generation == ImFontAtlasRectId_GetGeneration(id));
4370 IM_ASSERT(index_entry->IsUsed);
4371 return &builder->Rects[index_entry->TargetIndex];
4372}
4373
4374// For user-facing functions: return NULL on invalid ID.
4375// Important: return pointer is valid until next call to AddRect(), e.g. FindGlyph(), CalcTextSize() can all potentially invalidate previous pointers.
4376ImTextureRect* ImFontAtlasPackGetRectSafe(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontAtlasRectId id)
4377{
4378 if (id == ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid)
4379 return NULL;
4380 int index_idx = ImFontAtlasRectId_GetIndex(id);
4381 if (atlas->Builder == NULL)
4382 ImFontAtlasBuildInit(atlas);
4383 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = (ImFontAtlasBuilder*)atlas->Builder;
4384 if (index_idx >= builder->RectsIndex.Size)
4385 return NULL;
4386 ImFontAtlasRectEntry* index_entry = &builder->RectsIndex[index_idx];
4387 if (index_entry->Generation != ImFontAtlasRectId_GetGeneration(id) || !index_entry->IsUsed)
4388 return NULL;
4389 return &builder->Rects[index_entry->TargetIndex];
4390}
4391
4392// Important! This assume by ImFontConfig::GlyphExcludeRanges[] is a SMALL ARRAY (e.g. <10 entries)
4393// Use "Input Glyphs Overlap Detection Tool" to display a list of glyphs provided by multiple sources in order to set this array up.
4394static bool ImFontAtlasBuildAcceptCodepointForSource(ImFontConfig* src, ImWchar codepoint)
4395{
4396 if (const ImWchar* exclude_list = src->GlyphExcludeRanges)
4397 for (; exclude_list[0] != 0; exclude_list += 2)
4398 if (codepoint >= exclude_list[0] && codepoint <= exclude_list[1])
4399 return false;
4400 return true;
4401}
4402
4403static void ImFontBaked_BuildGrowIndex(ImFontBaked* baked, int new_size)
4404{
4405 IM_ASSERT(baked->IndexAdvanceX.Size == baked->IndexLookup.Size);
4406 if (new_size <= baked->IndexLookup.Size)
4407 return;
4408 baked->IndexAdvanceX.resize(new_size, -1.0f);
4409 baked->IndexLookup.resize(new_size, IM_FONTGLYPH_INDEX_UNUSED);
4410}
4411
4412static void ImFontAtlas_FontHookRemapCodepoint(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFont* font, ImWchar* c)
4413{
4414 IM_UNUSED(atlas);
4415 if (font->RemapPairs.Data.Size != 0)
4416 *c = (ImWchar)font->RemapPairs.GetInt((ImGuiID)*c, (int)*c);
4417}
4418
4419static ImFontGlyph* ImFontBaked_BuildLoadGlyph(ImFontBaked* baked, ImWchar codepoint, float* only_load_advance_x)
4420{
4421 ImFont* font = baked->ContainerFont;
4422 ImFontAtlas* atlas = font->ContainerAtlas;
4423 if (atlas->Locked || (font->Flags & ImFontFlags_NoLoadGlyphs))
4424 {
4425 // Lazily load fallback glyph
4426 if (baked->FallbackGlyphIndex == -1 && baked->LockLoadingFallback == 0)
4427 ImFontAtlasBuildSetupFontBakedFallback(baked);
4428 return NULL;
4429 }
4430
4431 // User remapping hooks
4432 ImWchar src_codepoint = codepoint;
4433 ImFontAtlas_FontHookRemapCodepoint(atlas, font, &codepoint);
4434
4435 //char utf8_buf[5];
4436 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG("[font] BuildLoadGlyph U+%04X (%s)\n", (unsigned int)codepoint, ImTextCharToUtf8(utf8_buf, (unsigned int)codepoint));
4437
4438 // Special hook
4439 // FIXME-NEWATLAS: it would be nicer if this used a more standardized way of hooking
4440 if (codepoint == font->EllipsisChar && font->EllipsisAutoBake)
4441 if (ImFontGlyph* glyph = ImFontAtlasBuildSetupFontBakedEllipsis(atlas, baked))
4442 return glyph;
4443
4444 // Call backend
4445 char* loader_user_data_p = (char*)baked->FontLoaderDatas;
4446 int src_n = 0;
4447 for (ImFontConfig* src : font->Sources)
4448 {
4449 const ImFontLoader* loader = src->FontLoader ? src->FontLoader : atlas->FontLoader;
4450 if (!src->GlyphExcludeRanges || ImFontAtlasBuildAcceptCodepointForSource(src, codepoint))
4451 {
4452 if (only_load_advance_x == NULL)
4453 {
4454 ImFontGlyph glyph_buf;
4455 if (loader->FontBakedLoadGlyph(atlas, src, baked, loader_user_data_p, codepoint, &glyph_buf, NULL))
4456 {
4457 // FIXME: Add hooks for e.g. #7962
4458 glyph_buf.Codepoint = src_codepoint;
4459 glyph_buf.SourceIdx = src_n;
4460 return ImFontAtlasBakedAddFontGlyph(atlas, baked, src, &glyph_buf);
4461 }
4462 }
4463 else
4464 {
4465 // Special mode but only loading glyphs metrics. Will rasterize and pack later.
4466 if (loader->FontBakedLoadGlyph(atlas, src, baked, loader_user_data_p, codepoint, NULL, only_load_advance_x))
4467 {
4468 ImFontAtlasBakedAddFontGlyphAdvancedX(atlas, baked, src, codepoint, *only_load_advance_x);
4469 return NULL;
4470 }
4471 }
4472 }
4473 loader_user_data_p += loader->FontBakedSrcLoaderDataSize;
4474 src_n++;
4475 }
4476
4477 // Lazily load fallback glyph
4478 if (baked->LockLoadingFallback)
4479 return NULL;
4480 if (baked->FallbackGlyphIndex == -1)
4481 ImFontAtlasBuildSetupFontBakedFallback(baked);
4482
4483 // Mark index as not found, so we don't attempt the search twice
4484 ImFontBaked_BuildGrowIndex(baked, codepoint + 1);
4485 baked->IndexAdvanceX[codepoint] = baked->FallbackAdvanceX;
4486 baked->IndexLookup[codepoint] = IM_FONTGLYPH_INDEX_NOT_FOUND;
4487 return NULL;
4488}
4489
4490static float ImFontBaked_BuildLoadGlyphAdvanceX(ImFontBaked* baked, ImWchar codepoint)
4491{
4492 if (baked->Size >= IMGUI_FONT_SIZE_THRESHOLD_FOR_LOADADVANCEXONLYMODE)
4493 {
4494 // First load AdvanceX value used by CalcTextSize() API then load the rest when loaded by drawing API.
4495 float only_advance_x = 0.0f;
4496 ImFontGlyph* glyph = ImFontBaked_BuildLoadGlyph(baked, (ImWchar)codepoint, &only_advance_x);
4497 return glyph ? glyph->AdvanceX : only_advance_x;
4498 }
4499 else
4500 {
4501 ImFontGlyph* glyph = ImFontBaked_BuildLoadGlyph(baked, (ImWchar)codepoint, NULL);
4502 return glyph ? glyph->AdvanceX : baked->FallbackAdvanceX;
4503 }
4504}
4505
4506// The point of this indirection is to not be inlined in debug mode in order to not bloat inner loop.b
4507IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_OFF
4508static float BuildLoadGlyphGetAdvanceOrFallback(ImFontBaked* baked, unsigned int codepoint)
4509{
4510 return ImFontBaked_BuildLoadGlyphAdvanceX(baked, (ImWchar)codepoint);
4511}
4512IM_MSVC_RUNTIME_CHECKS_RESTORE
4513
4514#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_DEBUG_TOOLS
4515void ImFontAtlasDebugLogTextureRequests(ImFontAtlas* atlas)
4516{
4517 // [DEBUG] Log texture update requests
4518 ImGuiContext& g = *GImGui;
4519 IM_UNUSED(g);
4520 for (ImTextureData* tex : atlas->TexList)
4521 {
4522 if ((g.IO.BackendFlags & ImGuiBackendFlags_RendererHasTextures) == 0)
4523 IM_ASSERT(tex->Updates.Size == 0);
4524 if (tex->Status == ImTextureStatus_WantCreate)
4525 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] Texture #%03d: create %dx%d\n", tex->UniqueID, tex->Width, tex->Height);
4526 else if (tex->Status == ImTextureStatus_WantDestroy)
4527 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] Texture #%03d: destroy %dx%d, texid=0x%" IM_PRIX64 ", backend_data=%p\n", tex->UniqueID, tex->Width, tex->Height, tex->TexID, tex->BackendUserData);
4528 else if (tex->Status == ImTextureStatus_WantUpdates)
4529 {
4530 IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] Texture #%03d: update %d regions, texid=0x%" IM_PRIX64 ", backend_data=0x%" IM_PRIX64 "\n", tex->UniqueID, tex->Updates.Size, tex->TexID, (ImU64)(intptr_t)tex->BackendUserData);
4531 for (const ImTextureRect& r : tex->Updates)
4532 {
4533 IM_UNUSED(r);
4534 IM_ASSERT(r.x >= 0 && r.y >= 0);
4535 IM_ASSERT(r.x + r.w <= tex->Width && r.y + r.h <= tex->Height); // In theory should subtract PackPadding but it's currently part of atlas and mid-frame change would wreck assert.
4536 //IMGUI_DEBUG_LOG_FONT("[font] Texture #%03d: update (% 4d..%-4d)->(% 4d..%-4d), texid=0x%" IM_PRIX64 ", backend_data=0x%" IM_PRIX64 "\n", tex->UniqueID, r.x, r.y, r.x + r.w, r.y + r.h, tex->TexID, (ImU64)(intptr_t)tex->BackendUserData);
4537 }
4538 }
4539 }
4540}
4541#endif
4542
4543//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
4544// [SECTION] ImFontAtlas: backend for stb_truetype
4545//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
4546// (imstb_truetype.h in included near the top of this file, when IMGUI_ENABLE_STB_TRUETYPE is set)
4547//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
4548
4549#ifdef IMGUI_ENABLE_STB_TRUETYPE
4550
4551// One for each ConfigData
4552struct ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData
4553{
4554 stbtt_fontinfo FontInfo;
4555 float ScaleFactor;
4556};
4557
4558static bool ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcInit(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontConfig* src)
4559{
4560 IM_UNUSED(atlas);
4561
4562 ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData* bd_font_data = IM_NEW(ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData);
4563 IM_ASSERT(src->FontLoaderData == NULL);
4564
4565 // Initialize helper structure for font loading and verify that the TTF/OTF data is correct
4566 const int font_offset = stbtt_GetFontOffsetForIndex((unsigned char*)src->FontData, src->FontNo);
4567 if (font_offset < 0)
4568 {
4569 IM_DELETE(bd_font_data);
4570 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(0, "stbtt_GetFontOffsetForIndex(): FontData is incorrect, or FontNo cannot be found.");
4571 return false;
4572 }
4573 if (!stbtt_InitFont(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, (unsigned char*)src->FontData, font_offset))
4574 {
4575 IM_DELETE(bd_font_data);
4576 IM_ASSERT_USER_ERROR(0, "stbtt_InitFont(): failed to parse FontData. It is correct and complete? Check FontDataSize.");
4577 return false;
4578 }
4579 src->FontLoaderData = bd_font_data;
4580
4581 if (src->MergeMode && src->SizePixels == 0.0f)
4582 src->SizePixels = src->DstFont->Sources[0]->SizePixels;
4583
4584 if (src->SizePixels >= 0.0f)
4585 bd_font_data->ScaleFactor = stbtt_ScaleForPixelHeight(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, 1.0f);
4586 else
4587 bd_font_data->ScaleFactor = stbtt_ScaleForMappingEmToPixels(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, 1.0f);
4588 if (src->MergeMode && src->SizePixels != 0.0f)
4589 bd_font_data->ScaleFactor *= src->SizePixels / src->DstFont->Sources[0]->SizePixels; // FIXME-NEWATLAS: Should tidy up that a bit
4590
4591 return true;
4592}
4593
4594static void ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcDestroy(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontConfig* src)
4595{
4596 IM_UNUSED(atlas);
4597 ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData* bd_font_data = (ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData*)src->FontLoaderData;
4598 IM_DELETE(bd_font_data);
4599 src->FontLoaderData = NULL;
4600}
4601
4602static bool ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcContainsGlyph(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontConfig* src, ImWchar codepoint)
4603{
4604 IM_UNUSED(atlas);
4605
4606 ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData* bd_font_data = (ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData*)src->FontLoaderData;
4607 IM_ASSERT(bd_font_data != NULL);
4608
4609 int glyph_index = stbtt_FindGlyphIndex(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, (int)codepoint);
4610 return glyph_index != 0;
4611}
4612
4613static bool ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontBakedInit(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontConfig* src, ImFontBaked* baked, void*)
4614{
4615 IM_UNUSED(atlas);
4616
4617 ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData* bd_font_data = (ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData*)src->FontLoaderData;
4618 if (src->MergeMode == false)
4619 {
4620 // FIXME-NEWFONTS: reevaluate how to use sizing metrics
4621 // FIXME-NEWFONTS: make use of line gap value
4622 float scale_for_layout = bd_font_data->ScaleFactor * baked->Size;
4623 int unscaled_ascent, unscaled_descent, unscaled_line_gap;
4624 stbtt_GetFontVMetrics(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, &unscaled_ascent, &unscaled_descent, &unscaled_line_gap);
4625 baked->Ascent = ImCeil(unscaled_ascent * scale_for_layout);
4626 baked->Descent = ImFloor(unscaled_descent * scale_for_layout);
4627 }
4628 return true;
4629}
4630
4631static bool ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontBakedLoadGlyph(ImFontAtlas* atlas, ImFontConfig* src, ImFontBaked* baked, void*, ImWchar codepoint, ImFontGlyph* out_glyph, float* out_advance_x)
4632{
4633 // Search for first font which has the glyph
4634 ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData* bd_font_data = (ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcData*)src->FontLoaderData;
4635 IM_ASSERT(bd_font_data);
4636 int glyph_index = stbtt_FindGlyphIndex(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, (int)codepoint);
4637 if (glyph_index == 0)
4638 return false;
4639
4640 // Fonts unit to pixels
4641 int oversample_h, oversample_v;
4642 ImFontAtlasBuildGetOversampleFactors(src, baked, &oversample_h, &oversample_v);
4643 const float scale_for_layout = bd_font_data->ScaleFactor * baked->Size;
4644 const float rasterizer_density = src->RasterizerDensity * baked->RasterizerDensity;
4645 const float scale_for_raster_x = bd_font_data->ScaleFactor * baked->Size * rasterizer_density * oversample_h;
4646 const float scale_for_raster_y = bd_font_data->ScaleFactor * baked->Size * rasterizer_density * oversample_v;
4647
4648 // Obtain size and advance
4649 int x0, y0, x1, y1;
4650 int advance, lsb;
4651 stbtt_GetGlyphBitmapBoxSubpixel(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, glyph_index, scale_for_raster_x, scale_for_raster_y, 0, 0, &x0, &y0, &x1, &y1);
4652 stbtt_GetGlyphHMetrics(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, glyph_index, &advance, &lsb);
4653
4654 // Load metrics only mode
4655 if (out_advance_x != NULL)
4656 {
4657 IM_ASSERT(out_glyph == NULL);
4658 *out_advance_x = advance * scale_for_layout;
4659 return true;
4660 }
4661
4662 // Prepare glyph
4663 out_glyph->Codepoint = codepoint;
4664 out_glyph->AdvanceX = advance * scale_for_layout;
4665
4666 // Pack and retrieve position inside texture atlas
4667 // (generally based on stbtt_PackFontRangesRenderIntoRects)
4668 const bool is_visible = (x0 != x1 && y0 != y1);
4669 if (is_visible)
4670 {
4671 const int w = (x1 - x0 + oversample_h - 1);
4672 const int h = (y1 - y0 + oversample_v - 1);
4673 ImFontAtlasRectId pack_id = ImFontAtlasPackAddRect(atlas, w, h);
4674 if (pack_id == ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid)
4675 {
4676 // Pathological out of memory case (TexMaxWidth/TexMaxHeight set too small?)
4677 IM_ASSERT(pack_id != ImFontAtlasRectId_Invalid && "Out of texture memory.");
4678 return false;
4679 }
4680 ImTextureRect* r = ImFontAtlasPackGetRect(atlas, pack_id);
4681
4682 // Render
4683 stbtt_GetGlyphBitmapBox(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, glyph_index, scale_for_raster_x, scale_for_raster_y, &x0, &y0, &x1, &y1);
4684 ImFontAtlasBuilder* builder = atlas->Builder;
4685 builder->TempBuffer.resize(w * h * 1);
4686 unsigned char* bitmap_pixels = builder->TempBuffer.Data;
4687 memset(bitmap_pixels, 0, w * h * 1);
4688 stbtt_MakeGlyphBitmapSubpixel(&bd_font_data->FontInfo, bitmap_pixels, r->w - oversample_h + 1, r->h - oversample_v + 1, w,
4689 scale_for_raster_x, scale_for_raster_y, 0, 0, glyph_index);
4690
4691 // Oversampling
4692 // (those functions conveniently assert if pixels are not cleared, which is another safety layer)
4693 if (oversample_h > 1)
4694 stbtt__h_prefilter(bitmap_pixels, r->w, r->h, r->w, oversample_h);
4695 if (oversample_v > 1)
4696 stbtt__v_prefilter(bitmap_pixels, r->w, r->h, r->w, oversample_v);
4697
4698 const float ref_size = baked->ContainerFont->Sources[0]->SizePixels;
4699 const float offsets_scale = (ref_size != 0.0f) ? (baked->Size / ref_size) : 1.0f;
4700 float font_off_x = (src->GlyphOffset.x * offsets_scale);
4701 float font_off_y = (src->GlyphOffset.y * offsets_scale);
4702 if (src->PixelSnapH) // Snap scaled offset. This is to mitigate backward compatibility issues for GlyphOffset, but a better design would be welcome.
4703 font_off_x = IM_ROUND(font_off_x);
4704 if (src->PixelSnapV)
4705 font_off_y = IM_ROUND(font_off_y);
4706 font_off_x += stbtt__oversample_shift(oversample_h);
4707 font_off_y += stbtt__oversample_shift(oversample_v) + IM_ROUND(baked->Ascent);
4708 float recip_h = 1.0f / (oversample_h * rasterizer_density);
4709 float recip_v = 1.0f / (oversample_v * rasterizer_density);
4710
4711 // Register glyph
4712 // r->x r->y are coordinates inside texture (in pixels)
4713 // glyph.X0, glyph.Y0 are drawing coordinates from base text position, and accounting for oversampling.
4714 out_glyph->X0 = x0 * recip_h + font_off_x;
4715 out_glyph->Y0 = y0 * recip_v + font_off_y;
4716 out_glyph->X1 = (x0 + (int)r->w) * recip_h + font_off_x;
4717 out_glyph->Y1 = (y0 + (int)r->h) * recip_v + font_off_y;
4718 out_glyph->Visible = true;
4719 out_glyph->PackId = pack_id;
4720 ImFontAtlasBakedSetFontGlyphBitmap(atlas, baked, src, out_glyph, r, bitmap_pixels, ImTextureFormat_Alpha8, w);
4721 }
4722
4723 return true;
4724}
4725
4726const ImFontLoader* ImFontAtlasGetFontLoaderForStbTruetype()
4727{
4728 static ImFontLoader loader;
4729 loader.Name = "stb_truetype";
4730 loader.FontSrcInit = ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcInit;
4731 loader.FontSrcDestroy = ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcDestroy;
4732 loader.FontSrcContainsGlyph = ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontSrcContainsGlyph;
4733 loader.FontBakedInit = ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontBakedInit;
4734 loader.FontBakedDestroy = NULL;
4735 loader.FontBakedLoadGlyph = ImGui_ImplStbTrueType_FontBakedLoadGlyph;
4736 return &loader;
4737}
4738
4739#endif // IMGUI_ENABLE_STB_TRUETYPE
4740
4741//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
4742// [SECTION] ImFontAtlas: glyph ranges helpers
4743//-------------------------------------------------------------------------
4744// - GetGlyphRangesDefault()
4745// Obsolete functions since 1.92:
4746// - GetGlyphRangesGreek()
4747// - GetGlyphRangesKorean()
4748// - GetGlyphRangesChineseFull()
4749// - GetGlyphRangesChineseSimplifiedCommon()
4750// - GetGlyphRangesJapanese()
4751// - GetGlyphRangesCyrillic()
4752// - GetGlyphRangesThai()
4753// - GetGlyphRangesVietnamese()
4754//-----------------------------------------------------------------------------
4755
4756// Retrieve list of range (2 int per range, values are inclusive)
4757const ImWchar* ImFontAtlas::GetGlyphRangesDefault()
4758{
4759 static const ImWchar ranges[] =
4760 {
4761 0x0020, 0x00FF, // Basic Latin + Latin Supplement
4762 0,
4763 };
4764 return &ranges[0];
4765}
4766
4767#ifndef IMGUI_DISABLE_OBSOLETE_FUNCTIONS
4768const ImWchar* ImFontAtlas::GetGlyphRangesGreek()
4769{
4770 static const ImWchar ranges[] =
4771 {
4772 0x0020, 0x00FF, // Basic Latin + Latin Supplement
4773 0x0370, 0x03FF, // Greek and Coptic
4774 0,
4775 };
4776 return &ranges[0];
4777}
4778
4779const ImWchar* ImFontAtlas::GetGlyphRangesKorean()
4780{
4781 static const ImWchar ranges[] =
4782 {
4783 0x0020, 0x00FF, // Basic Latin + Latin Supplement
4784 0x3131, 0x3163, // Korean alphabets
4785 0xAC00, 0xD7A3, // Korean characters
4786 0xFFFD, 0xFFFD, // Invalid
4787 0,
4788 };
4789 return &ranges[0];
4790}
4791
4792const ImWchar* ImFontAtlas::GetGlyphRangesChineseFull()
4793{
4794 static const ImWchar ranges[] =
4795 {
4796 0x0020, 0x00FF, // Basic Latin + Latin Supplement
4797 0x2000, 0x206F, // General Punctuation
4798 0x3000, 0x30FF, // CJK Symbols and Punctuations, Hiragana, Katakana
4799 0x31F0, 0x31FF, // Katakana Phonetic Extensions
4800 0xFF00, 0xFFEF, // Half-width characters
4801 0xFFFD, 0xFFFD, // Invalid
4802 0x4e00, 0x9FAF, // CJK Ideograms
4803 0,
4804 };
4805 return &ranges[0];
4806}
4807
4808static void UnpackAccumulativeOffsetsIntoRanges(int base_codepoint, const short* accumulative_offsets, int accumulative_offsets_count, ImWchar* out_ranges)
4809{
4810 for (int n = 0; n < accumulative_offsets_count; n++, out_ranges += 2)
4811 {
4812 out_ranges[0] = out_ranges[1] = (ImWchar)(base_codepoint + accumulative_offsets[n]);
4813 base_codepoint += accumulative_offsets[n];
4814 }
4815 out_ranges[0] = 0;
4816}
4817
4818const ImWchar* ImFontAtlas::GetGlyphRangesChineseSimplifiedCommon()
4819{
4820 // Store 2500 regularly used characters for Simplified Chinese.
4821 // Sourced from https://zh.wiktionary.org/wiki/%E9%99%84%E5%BD%95:%E7%8E%B0%E4%BB%A3%E6%B1%89%E8%AF%AD%E5%B8%B8%E7%94%A8%E5%AD%97%E8%A1%A8
4822 // This table covers 97.97% of all characters used during the month in July, 1987.
4823 // You can use ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder to create your own ranges derived from this, by merging existing ranges or adding new characters.
4824 // (Stored as accumulative offsets from the initial unicode codepoint 0x4E00. This encoding is designed to helps us compact the source code size.)
4825 static const short accumulative_offsets_from_0x4E00[] =
4826 {
4827 0,1,2,4,1,1,1,1,2,1,3,2,1,2,2,1,1,1,1,1,5,2,1,2,3,3,3,2,2,4,1,1,1,2,1,5,2,3,1,2,1,2,1,1,2,1,1,2,2,1,4,1,1,1,1,5,10,1,2,19,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,1,2,
4828 1,5,1,6,3,2,1,2,2,1,1,1,4,8,5,1,1,4,1,1,3,1,2,1,5,1,2,1,1,1,10,1,1,5,2,4,6,1,4,2,2,2,12,2,1,1,6,1,1,1,4,1,1,4,6,5,1,4,2,2,4,10,7,1,1,4,2,4,
4829 2,1,4,3,6,10,12,5,7,2,14,2,9,1,1,6,7,10,4,7,13,1,5,4,8,4,1,1,2,28,5,6,1,1,5,2,5,20,2,2,9,8,11,2,9,17,1,8,6,8,27,4,6,9,20,11,27,6,68,2,2,1,1,
4830 1,2,1,2,2,7,6,11,3,3,1,1,3,1,2,1,1,1,1,1,3,1,1,8,3,4,1,5,7,2,1,4,4,8,4,2,1,2,1,1,4,5,6,3,6,2,12,3,1,3,9,2,4,3,4,1,5,3,3,1,3,7,1,5,1,1,1,1,2,
4831 3,4,5,2,3,2,6,1,1,2,1,7,1,7,3,4,5,15,2,2,1,5,3,22,19,2,1,1,1,1,2,5,1,1,1,6,1,1,12,8,2,9,18,22,4,1,1,5,1,16,1,2,7,10,15,1,1,6,2,4,1,2,4,1,6,
4832 1,1,3,2,4,1,6,4,5,1,2,1,1,2,1,10,3,1,3,2,1,9,3,2,5,7,2,19,4,3,6,1,1,1,1,1,4,3,2,1,1,1,2,5,3,1,1,1,2,2,1,1,2,1,1,2,1,3,1,1,1,3,7,1,4,1,1,2,1,
4833 1,2,1,2,4,4,3,8,1,1,1,2,1,3,5,1,3,1,3,4,6,2,2,14,4,6,6,11,9,1,15,3,1,28,5,2,5,5,3,1,3,4,5,4,6,14,3,2,3,5,21,2,7,20,10,1,2,19,2,4,28,28,2,3,
4834 2,1,14,4,1,26,28,42,12,40,3,52,79,5,14,17,3,2,2,11,3,4,6,3,1,8,2,23,4,5,8,10,4,2,7,3,5,1,1,6,3,1,2,2,2,5,28,1,1,7,7,20,5,3,29,3,17,26,1,8,4,
4835 27,3,6,11,23,5,3,4,6,13,24,16,6,5,10,25,35,7,3,2,3,3,14,3,6,2,6,1,4,2,3,8,2,1,1,3,3,3,4,1,1,13,2,2,4,5,2,1,14,14,1,2,2,1,4,5,2,3,1,14,3,12,
4836 3,17,2,16,5,1,2,1,8,9,3,19,4,2,2,4,17,25,21,20,28,75,1,10,29,103,4,1,2,1,1,4,2,4,1,2,3,24,2,2,2,1,1,2,1,3,8,1,1,1,2,1,1,3,1,1,1,6,1,5,3,1,1,
4837 1,3,4,1,1,5,2,1,5,6,13,9,16,1,1,1,1,3,2,3,2,4,5,2,5,2,2,3,7,13,7,2,2,1,1,1,1,2,3,3,2,1,6,4,9,2,1,14,2,14,2,1,18,3,4,14,4,11,41,15,23,15,23,
4838 176,1,3,4,1,1,1,1,5,3,1,2,3,7,3,1,1,2,1,2,4,4,6,2,4,1,9,7,1,10,5,8,16,29,1,1,2,2,3,1,3,5,2,4,5,4,1,1,2,2,3,3,7,1,6,10,1,17,1,44,4,6,2,1,1,6,
4839 5,4,2,10,1,6,9,2,8,1,24,1,2,13,7,8,8,2,1,4,1,3,1,3,3,5,2,5,10,9,4,9,12,2,1,6,1,10,1,1,7,7,4,10,8,3,1,13,4,3,1,6,1,3,5,2,1,2,17,16,5,2,16,6,
4840 1,4,2,1,3,3,6,8,5,11,11,1,3,3,2,4,6,10,9,5,7,4,7,4,7,1,1,4,2,1,3,6,8,7,1,6,11,5,5,3,24,9,4,2,7,13,5,1,8,82,16,61,1,1,1,4,2,2,16,10,3,8,1,1,
4841 6,4,2,1,3,1,1,1,4,3,8,4,2,2,1,1,1,1,1,6,3,5,1,1,4,6,9,2,1,1,1,2,1,7,2,1,6,1,5,4,4,3,1,8,1,3,3,1,3,2,2,2,2,3,1,6,1,2,1,2,1,3,7,1,8,2,1,2,1,5,
4842 2,5,3,5,10,1,2,1,1,3,2,5,11,3,9,3,5,1,1,5,9,1,2,1,5,7,9,9,8,1,3,3,3,6,8,2,3,2,1,1,32,6,1,2,15,9,3,7,13,1,3,10,13,2,14,1,13,10,2,1,3,10,4,15,
4843 2,15,15,10,1,3,9,6,9,32,25,26,47,7,3,2,3,1,6,3,4,3,2,8,5,4,1,9,4,2,2,19,10,6,2,3,8,1,2,2,4,2,1,9,4,4,4,6,4,8,9,2,3,1,1,1,1,3,5,5,1,3,8,4,6,
4844 2,1,4,12,1,5,3,7,13,2,5,8,1,6,1,2,5,14,6,1,5,2,4,8,15,5,1,23,6,62,2,10,1,1,8,1,2,2,10,4,2,2,9,2,1,1,3,2,3,1,5,3,3,2,1,3,8,1,1,1,11,3,1,1,4,
4845 3,7,1,14,1,2,3,12,5,2,5,1,6,7,5,7,14,11,1,3,1,8,9,12,2,1,11,8,4,4,2,6,10,9,13,1,1,3,1,5,1,3,2,4,4,1,18,2,3,14,11,4,29,4,2,7,1,3,13,9,2,2,5,

4862 4,1,3,4,2,1,6,2,1,3,4,1,2,1,1,1,1,12,5,7,2,4,3,1,1,1,3,3,6,1,2,2,3,3,3,2,1,2,12,14,11,6,6,4,12,2,8,1,7,10,1,35,7,4,13,15,4,3,23,21,28,52,5,
4863 26,5,6,1,7,10,2,7,53,3,2,1,1,1,2,163,532,1,10,11,1,3,3,4,8,2,8,6,2,2,23,22,4,2,2,4,2,1,3,1,3,3,5,9,8,2,1,2,8,1,10,2,12,21,20,15,105,2,3,1,1,
4864 3,2,3,1,1,2,5,1,4,15,11,19,1,1,1,1,5,4,5,1,1,2,5,3,5,12,1,2,5,1,11,1,1,15,9,1,4,5,3,26,8,2,1,3,1,1,15,19,2,12,1,2,5,2,7,2,19,2,20,6,26,7,5,
4865 2,2,7,34,21,13,70,2,128,1,1,2,1,1,2,1,1,3,2,2,2,15,1,4,1,3,4,42,10,6,1,49,85,8,1,2,1,1,4,4,2,3,6,1,5,7,4,3,211,4,1,2,1,2,5,1,2,4,2,2,6,5,6,
4866 10,3,4,48,100,6,2,16,296,5,27,387,2,2,3,7,16,8,5,38,15,39,21,9,10,3,7,59,13,27,21,47,5,21,6
4867 };
4868 static ImWchar base_ranges[] = // not zero-terminated
4869 {
4870 0x0020, 0x00FF, // Basic Latin + Latin Supplement
4871 0x2000, 0x206F, // General Punctuation
4872 0x3000, 0x30FF, // CJK Symbols and Punctuations, Hiragana, Katakana
4873 0x31F0, 0x31FF, // Katakana Phonetic Extensions
4874 0xFF00, 0xFFEF, // Half-width characters
4875 0xFFFD, 0xFFFD // Invalid
4876 };
4877 static ImWchar full_ranges[IM_ARRAYSIZE(base_ranges) + IM_ARRAYSIZE(accumulative_offsets_from_0x4E00) * 2 + 1] = { 0 };
4878 if (!full_ranges[0])
4879 {
4880 memcpy(full_ranges, base_ranges, sizeof(base_ranges));
4881 UnpackAccumulativeOffsetsIntoRanges(0x4E00, accumulative_offsets_from_0x4E00, IM_ARRAYSIZE(accumulative_offsets_from_0x4E00), full_ranges + IM_ARRAYSIZE(base_ranges));
4882 }
4883 return &full_ranges[0];
4884}
4885
4886const ImWchar* ImFontAtlas::GetGlyphRangesJapanese()
4887{
4888 // 2999 ideograms code points for Japanese
4889 // - 2136 Joyo (meaning "for regular use" or "for common use") Kanji code points
4890 // - 863 Jinmeiyo (meaning "for personal name") Kanji code points
4891 // - Sourced from official information provided by the government agencies of Japan:
4892 // - List of Joyo Kanji by the Agency for Cultural Affairs
4893 // - https://www.bunka.go.jp/kokugo_nihongo/sisaku/joho/joho/kijun/naikaku/kanji/
4894 // - List of Jinmeiyo Kanji by the Ministry of Justice
4895 // - http://www.moj.go.jp/MINJI/minji86.html
4896 // - Available under the terms of the Creative Commons Attribution 4.0 International (CC BY 4.0).
4897 // - https://creativecommons.org/licenses/by/4.0/legalcode
4898 // - You can generate this code by the script at:
4899 // - https://github.com/vaiorabbit/everyday_use_kanji
4900 // - References:
4901 // - List of Joyo Kanji
4902 // - (Wikipedia) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/List_of_j%C5%8Dy%C5%8D_kanji
4903 // - List of Jinmeiyo Kanji
4904 // - (Wikipedia) https://en.wikipedia.org/wiki/Jinmeiy%C5%8D_kanji
4905 // - Missing 1 Joyo Kanji: U+20B9F (Kun'yomi: Shikaru, On'yomi: Shitsu,shichi), see https://github.com/ocornut/imgui/pull/3627 for details.
4906 // You can use ImFontGlyphRangesBuilder to create your own ranges derived from this, by merging existing ranges or adding new characters.
4907 // (Stored as accumulative offsets from the initial unicode codepoint 0x4E00. This encoding is designed to helps us compact the source code size.)
4908 static const short accumulative_offsets_from_0x4E00[] =
4909 {
4910 0,1,2,4,1,1,1,1,2,1,3,3,2,2,1,5,3,5,7,5,6,1,2,1,7,2,6,3,1,8,1,1,4,1,1,18,2,11,2,6,2,1,2,1,5,1,2,1,3,1,2,1,2,3,3,1,1,2,3,1,1,1,12,7,9,1,4,5,1,
